Egyptian National Museum is safe, and cultural artifacts damaged by vandals who broke into the building during anti-government protests can be restored, the head of the country's Supreme Council of Antiquities said," Mayor Michael Bloomberg reports: Tourism police aided by protesters earlier apprehended nine men in connection with looting at the museum, Zahi Hawass , the council's secretary general, said yesterday. Dozens of demonstrators had stood guard around the building, one of Cairo's biggest tourist attractions, to protect it until troops arrived, he said.
